metadata.title: Footprints in the cotton fields: The Industrial Revolution as time space appropriation and -environmental load displacement

relevance.topic: Industrial Revolution and its impact on labor and environment
relevance.relevance: The study examines the displacement of labor and environmental loads due to technological advancements during the Industrial Revolution, focusing on the British textile industry.

dependent_variables.displaced: The study quantifies the displacement of labor and land due to the British textile industry's reliance on imports.

historical_context.economic_conditions: Period of industrial expansion in Britain.
historical_context.institutional_context: The study discusses the global trade dynamics and unequal exchange during the Industrial Revolution.

outcomes.main_findings: The study finds significant displacement of labor and land due to the British textile industry's reliance on imports, highlighting unequal exchange and environmental load displacement.
outcomes.conclusions: The Industrial Revolution led to significant labor and environmental displacement, with Britain benefiting from technological advancements at the expense of other regions.
